greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Multiplicative with a(p^k) = p*a(k) for any prime p and k>0.
comment: To compute a(n): multiply (with multiplicity) each prime number appearing in the prime tower factorization of n (see A182318 for definition).
a(n) = n if n is squarefree.
First differs from A000026 at n=256: a(256)=12 and A000026(256)=16.
If n=p_1 * p_2 * ... * p_k with p_1, p_2, ..., p_k primes, then a(p_1 ^ p_2 ^ ... ^ p_k) = n.
reference: Steven R. Finch, Mathematical Constants, Cambridge University Press, 2003, Section 2.33 Hall-Montgomery Constant, p. 207.
link: Rémy Sigrist, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
mathematica: a[n_] := a[n] = If[n==1, 1, Times @@ (#[[1]] a[#[[2]]]& /@ FactorInteger[n] )]; Array[a, 256] (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Mar 31 2017 *)
results.author: _Rémy Sigrist_, Dec 13 2016
